title: A YT Channel On Decentralization
description: 大衆は暗号を理解していません。さらに悪いことに、大手メディアは彼らの理解を妨げるために誤った偏った情報を流しています。

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer is looking for $20,000 to continue working on his youtube channel (currently 23 subs with about 50 views per video). The proposal itself seems to revolve about teaching people about blockchain in creative ways through drinking games, music and more. It does not specifically talk about Project Catalyst or attracting people to participate in Catalyst and submit proposals. He is also looking at collabing with other more popular channels and introduce 'crypto concepts' in their channels. Again, no mention of informing people about Catalyst is mentioned. This could be a good proposal but require much more work and proof of actuation. Goals defined are not synchronous with the challenge goals. The idea of granting money to youtubers without anything to show for it does not seem a good allocation of funds. Granting money to already popular youtubers in order to create content on Catalyst seems much more fruitful and would probably cost less.
f6_assessments.q1: Given the low popularity of the channel, it is unlikely that more popular channels would be compelled to collab with the proposer. The videos already published by the proposer do not seem compelling to watch and lack flow. No proof of past tutoring by the proposer was provided (CV, past tutor work, links to tuition website/other). Proposer himself looks quite young so 'many years' are presumed to mean less than 5 years.
f6_assessments.q2: It is hard to audit whether any viewers of the channel actually end up participating in catalyst. The proposal looks more like an idea rather than a plan as it involves many variables. The goals described can be tracked by checking the person's channel but are not aligned with the Challenge.

f6_assessments.q0:
Has the problem needing to be solved been identified and articulated?
The problem is that most people do not understand crypto. This has been identified.
 

Does this proposal fall within the scope of the challenge brief?
Yes
 

Does this proposal show clearly how it will add value to the Cardano System?
Somewhat clear but on a practicality scale 40%.
 
Have key metrics and goals of the proposal been stated clearly 
They have been stated clearly. Practically and realistically speaking more work may need to be done to ensure goals are met.
 

Do the key metrics and goals of the proposal fall within the scope of the challenge
Yes
 

Can the proposal scale to address future challenges?
Yes
f6_assessments.q1:
Has the proposer provided evidence (references, links, etc.) of relevant skills and experience needed to implement the proposal?
Yes. A Youtube channel with 23 subscribers, and 11 videos done over 4 months.
No team members have been mentioned.
 

Are these links sufficient?
No. A Linkedin profile, FB profile, CV, or record of past experience would have been useful.

 

Have you the CA visited these links and contacted the relevant people?
Yes I visited the YT channel. There are no other links.
 

Have you been able to assess their level of competence?
Yes. Their competence will grow with time. Capability of accomplishing this alone would be fairly low. It would be better to have a team behind him.


Does proposer know, in an identifiable manner, the type and number of team members required to implement the proposal?
There seem to be no team members

 Has he rationally and logically laid out his team structure and breakdown?
There is no team

 
Has budget been outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items?
No


Is budget reasonable to achieve the set goals?
No

Has the proposer provided a verifiable plan if additional funding is required to implement the proposal?
No backup plan is indicated

Have you verified this plan?
None is available


Does proposal offer a realistic timetable to complete the work?
No. He wants a donation to his stakepool.

 Does the proposal provide a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how?
No

 

Does the plan describe the resources necessary to implement the proposal?
No


 

Does the proposal clearly explain  technical aspects like architecture, language and technologies if they are crucial for implementation?
No

 

Has the proposer considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation?
No
f6_assessments.q2:
Is there clearly laid out a roadmap with milestones and a time horizon for achievement.
There is a roadmap. It doesnt seem to be very realistic or practical. It assumes that other channels of several hundreds of thousands subscribers would partner with a channel with less than a 100 subscribers.  No indication has been given about YT ad costs, what the ad marketing plan is, the percentages of viewers who become prospects, and subscribers. 



 

Are there clearly defined Metrics/KPIs that define the success of the proposal?
There are metrics but there is no basis on which I can see a plan for meeting them.



 

Is there a clear understandable description of the targeted problem?
Yes

 

Is there a clear understandable solution that addresses the problem?
Yes


 

Has the proposer identified possible hurdles, challenges and difficulties?
No

 

How does the proposer plan to deal with these difficulties?
No plan indicated.

 

Are there contingency plans in place for various outcomes?
None

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer has certainly identified a valid problem that requires attention. How to encourage more proposers with ideas that lack blockchain understanding. This proposal aims to address the problem by using everyday examples to translate the technology using innovative education techniques (referred to as translating). This makes sense and I commend the rationale of the idea. The YT channel is still new and I wonder if this aspect means adding value for the Cardano community. I can see that with time the proposer may grow their channel but feel that the funds requested do not meet the outcomes required at this stage. Grow the channel and develop the content to remedy this aspect.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposer may have excellent experience and knowledge to present what in essence is a good idea. However, there simply is not enough within the proposal to ascertain how true this is. The YT channel does exist and a quick review of the content suggests the proposer has a certain style that may attract followers but that may not be enough to attract votes for funding.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has merit but simply does not contain the level of detail required to be a realistic funding proposal at this stage. The budget is too simplified and requires further breakdown in order to be auditable. I would highly recommend the proposer seek out like minded Cardano community members and form collaborative teams, develop further content (especially innovative educational experiences for YT followers) and hone their proposal writing skills.

f6_assessments.q0:
reasons why it does not EFFECTIVELY address the challenge:

1. yt is very competitive, and you need to stand out to have views
2. having such a channel increases awareness, viewers but proposers - just indirectly 
3. there are already multiple proposers with the same idea.
4. I do not think having music, cooking or any other stuff related to crypto is actually helping people to understand it better

suggestion - try to work on visuals + decrease the time of presentation (rather split it into 10, than having one-hour killing talk)

But I get the point, definitely, having a channel which provides relevant information in an easy to understand way, can increase - as one of effects - proposer outreach
f6_assessments.q1: I believe that the proposer can deliver videos with the content correlating with the proposal, but the quality of it (speech, presentation, organization) has a way to go.
f6_assessments.q2:
we can track number of videos
number of views
likes
shares
comments

but we can not track how many unique proposers joined due to videos

unless you do a survey

which will be incomplete...thus not so reliable. So we can audit it, to some extent

f6_assessments.q0: I think the proposal addresses the challenge, however there are already a plethora of Youtube channels which aim to educate the masses about Crypto and its use cases. Some have over 1 million subscribers and are well established already. It is very hard to start a following on Youtube or other social media platforms and those who have done it currently do a very good Job of educatioin in the space.
f6_assessments.q1: I do not think the proposal will be implemented effectively as I suggested above, it is very hard to build a youtube following and there are already many influencers doing this job currently.
f6_assessments.q2: I do not think there is enough information about how the funds being delegated in to the stake pool would be used to promote the Youtube channel. If there was an established Youtube channel already, then funds could be allocated to the staking pool via viewers which is common for established content creators.

solution: 音楽や料理などのYTチャンネルと提携して、暗号の仕組みを解説するYTチャンネル。ブロックチェーンを教えるのではなく、翻訳する。
experience: 私は長年家庭教師をしていたので、抽象的な概念を教える才能があります。
